an6.84:1.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
an6.84:1.3: It’s when a mendicant has many desires—they’re frustrated and not content with any kind of robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And they’re faithless, unethical, unmindful, and witless.
an6.84:1.4: A mendicant with these six qualities can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
an6.84:2.1: A mendicant with six qualities can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.
an6.84:2.3: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t have many desires—they’re not frustrated but content with any kind of robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And they’re faithful, ethical, mindful, and wise.
an6.84:2.4: A mendicant with these six qualities can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.”
